title: Neal Cotts to be inducted in Illinois State Hall of Fame
text:
Former White Sox and Cubs pitcher Neal Cotts will be inducted into the Illinois State University Hall of Fame on Saturday.
Neal Cotts will be inducted into the ISU Percy Family Hall of Fame! Congrats! #TBT pic.twitter.com/9JBwUghPOS
— Redbird Baseball (@RedbirdBaseball) October 22, 2015
Cotts was 4-0 with a 1.94 ERA in 69 games for the 2005 World Series champion White Sox.
The left-hander was taken by the Oakland A’s in the second round—69th overall—of the 2001 MLB Draft after three seasons with the Redbirds. Dave Bergman (1974, Yankees, 2nd round, 31st overall) was the only Redbird ever drafted higher.
Cotts, who still pitches for the Milwaukee Brewers, will be inducted into the Percy Family Hall of Fame along with former NFL receiver Laurent Robinson, former WNBA player Kristi Cirone, golfer Brian Anderson and tennis player Liina Suurvarik.
